newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenia's Terme Catez says H1 net profit up 5 pct.
newsitem.headline: Slovenia's Terme Catez says H1 net profit up 5 pct.

text.p: Slovenian health resort operator Terme Catez said on Tuesday first half net profit in 1996 was 177.2 million tolars ($1.3 million) against 168.2 million in the same period of 1995.

"The profit was up because of an increase in sales in most areas of our business although the number of overnight stays eased 2 percent to 189,520 in the first six months of the year," deputy chief executive Zvonko Krulc told Reuters.
Turnover rose 16 percent to 1.1 billion tolars.
Krulc also said the company planned to list its shares abroad next year.
"We will list our shares on the Vienna or London stock exchange because we would like to gain an international reputation," Krulc said.
Until now no Slovenian company has listed its shares abroad.

Shares of Terme Catez, which are listed on the primary market of the Ljubljana bourse, on Tuesday rose 2.66 percent to 10,149 on volume of 6,341 shares for total turnover of 64.4 million tolars. -- Marja Novak, Ljubljana newsroom, 386-61-125-8439
